validation_checks.name: Check unique class identifiers
validation_checks.purpose: Ensure every class has a unique `id` so that downstream agents can reference components unambiguously.

validation_checks.name: Check coherence of id, file_path, and class_name
validation_checks.purpose: Verify that each class ID corresponds logically to its file path and class name, ensuring a stable mapping for code generation.

validation_checks.name: Check symmetry between depends_on and used_by
validation_checks.purpose: Confirm that dependency relationships are correctly mirrored: if A depends on B, then B must list A in used_by, maintaining directional consistency.

validation_checks.name: Check interactions align with depends_on
validation_checks.purpose: Validate that classes only declare interactions with components they explicitly depend on, preventing hidden or impossible relationships.

validation_checks.name: Verify domain model passivity
validation_checks.purpose: Ensure domain model classes declare no outward interactions or dependencies, matching architectural rules for passive data holders.

validation_checks.name: Validate architectural layering
validation_checks.purpose: Check that component relationships follow the intended top-down flow (Main → Service → Repository → Storage) with no forbidden upward or lateral dependencies.

validation_checks.name: Check absence of reverse or symmetric interactions
validation_checks.purpose: Ensure no class incorrectly declares reciprocal interactions or dependencies unless explicitly allowed by rules.

validation_checks.name: Validate compliance with relationship ruleset
validation_checks.purpose: Verify that the relationship object follows all defined directionality, interaction, and domain model rules to maintain a predictable architecture.
